CIRCULAR NO. AS - 1/2044

Sub: Courtesy to Members of Parliament and other ViPs at the airports:
Reg;-

Reference is made to the BCAS Circular 18/2009 regarding courtesy to the
Hon'ble MPs at the airport and Airport Sector Circular 23/2006, Airport Sector
Circular No 01/2008 and Airport Sector Circular 05/2010 regarding courteous
behavior to the Hon'ble MPs and VIPs.

02 Even after repeated instructions and guidelines issued by higher formations,
number of incidents have come to the notice of his HQ in which, the Hon'ble MPs
and other VIPs have alleged that CISF staff failed to extend due courtesy and
protocol to the Hon'ble MPs and other dignitaries.

03 It is once again directed that all ASG personnel including those newly posted
to the ASGs must be briefed regarding courtecus behavior towards all passengers in
general and to Hon'ble MPs/VIPs and other high ranking officials in particular. This
should be repeatedly done at frequent intervals. On analysis of the incidents
reported, it appeared that the complaints are mostly due to the indifferent and
apathetic behaviour exhibited by the ASG staff even though they are not
discourteous. This indifference needs to be improved to a proactive approach and
pleasant demeanor:

04 All CASOs may take a proactive approach in maintaining close liaison with the
State Gowlocal police/Airport operator/airlines. and deploying personnel during VIP
movements. CASOs should also work with a focus to improve upon the behaviour
and attitude of our personnel with all passengers and continue efforts to sustain
such behaviour through close supervision and motivation of the personnel

05 Zonal DisG should ensure strict implementation of the above instructions in
the units under their respective jurisdiction and emphasize on these aspects during
inspection/visit to the ASGs.

(Arun Chaudhary
Spl. Director General/AS
